recipe.title: Margherita Pizza
recipe.description: Classic Italian pizza with fresh mozzarella, tomato, and basil

on_enter.say: Right, let's preheat the oven to two hundred forty degrees celsius, which is about four hundred seventy-five degrees fahrenheit. This will ensure our pizza has a lovely crispy crust.

steps.descr: Roll out pizza dough on a floured surface
steps.instructions: Roll out pizza dough on a floured surface

on_enter.say: Now, let's roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface. We want it nice and thin, so it bakes up crispy and delicious.

steps.descr: Mix passata with garlic, olive oil, and salt
steps.instructions: Mix passata with garlic, olive oil, and salt

on_enter.say: Let's mix the passata with the minced garlic, olive oil, and a pinch of salt. Give it a good stir until everything is well combined. This will be the base of our pizza.

steps.descr: Spread sauce over dough, leaving a border
steps.instructions: Spread sauce over dough, leaving a border

on_enter.say: Now, spread that lovely sauce over the dough, leaving a small border around the edges. This will give us a nice crust.

steps.descr: Tear mozzarella and distribute over pizza
steps.instructions: Tear mozzarella and distribute over pizza

on_enter.say: Let's tear the fresh mozzarella into pieces and distribute them evenly over the pizza. This will melt beautifully in the oven.

steps.descr: Bake for 10-12 minutes until crust is golden
steps.instructions: Bake for 10-12 minutes until crust is golden

on_enter.say: Time to bake our pizza! Pop it in the oven for ten to twelve minutes until the crust is golden and the cheese is bubbling. You'll know it's ready when it smells irresistible!

steps.descr: Top with fresh basil and drizzle with olive oil
steps.instructions: Top with fresh basil and drizzle with olive oil

on_enter.say: Finally, let's top our beautiful pizza with fresh basil leaves and a drizzle of olive oil. This adds a lovely fresh flavour and aroma. Enjoy your homemade Margherita Pizza!

notes.text:
A pizza stone gives the best crust
Let dough come to room temperature before rolling
Less is more - don't overload with toppings
